attributes.action: financialy support a patent pool which would make AIDS treatment more affordable
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Affordable HIV treatment could save 6,000 lives a day. But this is not happening.

When pharmaceutical companies create a new type of drug, they automatically own the exclusive right, or patent, which prevents the manufacture of cheap, generic copies.

A 'patent pool' is a proposed system, financed by 5 countries including the UK, that would enable the production of affordable HIV medicines.

The good news is the UK Government is leaning towards supporting the pool. What's needed now is a strong show of public pressure to get them fully onboard.
